subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Battle of Karbala
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Battle of Karbala.

hook.text: Seventy-two against thousands. Hussein refused to submit to a tyrant. He was killed, and Shia Islam was born in grief.

buildup.text: In 680 CE, Caliph Yazid demanded allegiance. Hussein, grandson of Muhammad, refused to accept an unjust ruler.

discovery.text: At Karbala in Iraq, Hussein and his small band were surrounded, denied water, and slaughtered over ten days.

twist.text: Hussein knew he would die but chose martyrdom over submission. His stand made injustice intolerable for Shia Muslims.

climax.text: Every year, millions mourn Hussein during Ashura. Karbala taught that standing against tyranny is worth dying for.

punchline.text: Hussein chose death over injustice. Karbala still inspires resistance.

quiz.question: Why is the Battle of Karbala significant?
options: It was a great military victory
Hussein's martyrdom became the defining event of Shia Islam
